perturbation.original_text: Except as otherwise provided herein, all fees and expenses payable hereunder for which Developer issues an invoice to Distributor shall be due and payable thirty (30) days from the date of the invoice. A late payment charge of the lesser of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month or the highest interest rate allowed by applicable law shall be charged upon all unpaid amounts due hereunder for more than thirty (30) days.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as otherwise provided herein, all fees and expenses payable hereunder for which Developer issues an invoice to Distributor shall be due and payable sixty (60) days from the date of the invoice. A late payment charge of the lesser of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month or the highest interest rate allowed by applicable law shall be charged upon all unpaid amounts due hereunder for more than thirty (30) days.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by specifying different payment deadlines. Section 2.2 initially states that invoices are due within 30 days, but now it states 60 days, while the late payment charge still applies after 30 days. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding when late fees are applicable.

perturbation.original_text:
Distributor will submit a monthly report to Developer which accurately identifies the Software license fees, maintenance fees, and any other fees set forth in this Agreement (repons outlined in Schedule D). This report is due at
the earliest possible time, but in no event later than ten (10) days following the end of each calendar month Payment by Distributor of the applicable royalty fees to Developer shall accompany the report; provided, however, that Developer shall have the reasonable fight to inspect Distributor's books from time to time during the term hereof and for a one (1) year period after the termination of this Agreement for purposes of verifying the royalties payable to Developer. In addition, Distributor shall report the acquisition of each new license  for the Software system to Developer and will provide either an English translation of the End-User License Agreement or a completed contract extract schedule in the form of Exhibit D (Contract Summary Form) within one (1) day of accepting the order.
perturbation.changed_text:
Distributor will submit a monthly report to Developer which accurately identifies the Software license fees, maintenance fees, and any other fees set forth in this Agreement (repons outlined in Schedule D). This report is due at
the earliest possible time, but in no event later than thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar month Payment by Distributor of the applicable royalty fees to Developer shall accompany the report; provided, however, that Developer shall have the reasonable fight to inspect Distributor's books from time to time during the term hereof and for a one (1) year period after the termination of this Agreement for purposes of verifying the royalties payable to Developer. In addition, Distributor shall report the acquisition of each new license  for the Software system to Developer and will provide either an English translation of the End-User License Agreement or a completed contract extract schedule in the form of Exhibit D (Contract Summary Form) within five (5) days of accepting the order.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates a contradiction by modifying the reporting and documentation deadlines. The section initially mandates that the monthly report be submitted within 10 days of each month's end, but now says 30 days. The requirement to provide an English translation of each license agreement is changed from 1 day to 5 days. This inconsistency results in uncertainty regarding the stipulated timeframes.
